engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The use of observation and measurement to understand and quantify the universe's expansion and estimate the time elapsed since the Big Bang.
The principle of redshift effect, where the wavelength of light appears to stretch as it moves away from an observer in an expanding universe, shifting it towards longer, redder wavelengths.
The principle of determining the distance and speed of distant galaxies based on the redshift effect, providing valuable insights into the history and evolution of the universe.

engineering_design_principles.description: Use of Geometric and Physical Concepts
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The use of concepts from geometry and physics, such as the Doppler effect, to explain the redshift effect and the universe's expansion.
